pullRequest.body:
Explore the relationship between the Centroid of a ring and algebra:

- A a non-unital, non-associative semiring Î± is an algebra over the Semiring CentroidHom Î±
- When the non-unital, non-associative semiring Î±  is an algebra over the commutative semiring R, then CentroidHom Î± is a ring over R, provided the range of the natural ring homomorphism from R into CentroidHom Î± lies in the center of CentroidHom Î±.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

-->

:v: mans0954 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7328978438/job/19958013259)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7328978438/job/19958013639)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7328978438/job/19958013943)
bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion Algebra R (CentroidHom Î±) := algHom.toAlgebra' h ```
What's the purpose of these lemmas? If it's just for dot notation, can you add a comment to that effect?
I appeared to need them in my previous draft. The argument seems to work without them now, so I have removed them. Thanks.
This should really just be `r â€¢ id`; I'm working on a patch to make that so.
Thank you very much!
I pushed that change.
I think this should be called `Module.toCentroidHom` to match `Module.toAddMonoidEnd`
Done, thanks.

```suggestion
/-- The natural ring homomorphism from `R` into `CentroidHom Î±` -/
@[simps apply_toFun]
```
Can you put backticks around the lean code here?
Done, thanks.

I'm not fully convinced that this definition is worth having, since it is only a little shorter than writing `Module.toCentroidHom.toAlgebra' h`.

Do you have a use-case in mind where this shorter spelling makes much difference? If not, I'd be inclined to remove it (and the extra import I think it requires).

(The same does not apply to `toCentroidHom` above, as that's following an existing pattern)

@eric-wieser  I can remove `ringToAlg` - but then it feels to me like this PR isn't quite reaching it's natural conclusion.

How would you feel about:
```
open Module in
/-- `CentroidHom Î±` as an algebra over `R`. -/
example (h : âˆ€ (r : R) (T : CentroidHom Î±), toCentroidHom r * T = T * toCentroidHom r) :
    Algebra R (CentroidHom Î±) := toCentroidHom.toAlgebra' h
```
?
Sure, that seems harmless. Did you have a result you were intending to build on top of this in a later PR?

@eric-wieser not specifically, but when `Î±` is a module over `R`, the homomorphisms are usually taken to be `R`-linear so I though it important to indicate how to get from our ring definition to the module/algebra situation.

For clarity:
```suggestion
The following instances show that `Î±` is an non-unital and non-associative algebra over `CentroidHom Î±`
```
I pushed a golf here, `RingHom.smulOneHom` was added recently.
Thanks.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Ring/CentroidHom): CentroidHom and algebras
